timeline.message: Use BackgroundWorkManager abstraction to look up AutoSendWorker status
Make sure apps sttate is reset before activity is launched in migration tests
Reset Dagger deps as part of ResetStateRule
Move dependency overriding to ResetStateRule and make sure JavaRosa is reinitialized
Just clear directories - don't use app's reset logic

Revert "Just clear directories - don't use app's reset logic"

This reverts commit 64f642dfeb6b2e1f89e4fd05af5b7aa993733f09.

Revert "Just clear directories - don't use app's reset logic"

This reverts commit 64f642dfeb6b2e1f89e4fd05af5b7aa993733f09.

timeline.bodyText: Why is this needed? Isn't that the default runner?
timeline.author: lognaturel

replies.bodyText: You technically don't need it but I think it's weird not to have it. It is possible to specify other ones and the Google team loves deprecating/changing them.
replies.author: seadowg

timeline.bodyText: Not important to change now but there are lots of doReturn calls in this test file that should use the newer and more readable when/thenReturn syntax. See the javadoc: Use doReturn() in those rare occasions when you cannot use when(Object). CC @grzesiek2010
timeline.author: lognaturel

replies.bodyText: Right probably I used spies then refactored to mocks and forgot to update here.
replies.author: grzesiek2010

timeline.bodyText: These doNothing calls shouldn't be needed because storageEraser is a mock. It's needed below for the reopenDatabases because storageMigrator is a spy and not all of its methods can be run. CC @grzesiek2010
timeline.author: lognaturel

replies.bodyText: Right probably I used spies then refactored to mocks and forgot to update here.
replies.author: grzesiek2010

timeline.bodyText: I didn't realize that applications were never recreated in Espresso tests before @seadowg explained this one to me. So Collect.onCreate does not run for every test.
timeline.author: lognaturel

timeline.bodyText: I don't think this is needed. Because of the KEYS_WE_SHOULD_NOT_RESET map, the scoped storage setting can't be changed by a settings file.
timeline.author: lognaturel

replies.bodyText: It's called in onResume() and that's enough.
replies.author: grzesiek2010

replies.bodyText: Oh my bad another mistake. I was experimenting with test coverage and left this in. @grzesiek2010 is totally right it's only needed in onResume
replies.author: seadowg

timeline.author: grzesiek2010

replies.bodyText: It was originally. I actually ended up on a call with @lognaturel to double check all the JavaRosa stuff (as I'm not as knowledgable about all that) and we ended up deciding to put this here. The reasoning was that the app doesn't need reset() to be called (it already handles setting up the ReferenceManager) but CopyFormRule does need it.
replies.author: seadowg

timeline.bodyText: What is the advantage of this change?
timeline.author: grzesiek2010

replies.bodyText: oooo nice catch. That's a mistake. I think I'd looked at passing one in for some reason but abandoned the idea. I'll revert that.
replies.author: seadowg

timeline.bodyText: I feel anxious about the test you removed that verified those two methods. Those were android tests because starting evernote job / worker didn't work with Robolectric I don't know why. It required some time but at least it was verified and we were sure it won't cause any problem during migration. Now you moved the code here and it looks fine but generally when you refactor something it's good to add tests in this case we have refactoring and removing tests.
timeline.author: grzesiek2010

replies.bodyText:
I can completely see where you're coming from here. The motivation behind changing the tests is that locally and on CI they were failing on and off as the waits wouldn't always work.
I looked at faking out JobManager/WorkManager in the StorageMigrator tests but was unable to due to JobManager being a final class. Generally I'd wrap a depedency like this as I'm not trying to test that JobManager works but that our code that interacts with it does. Granted here we're wrapping a chunk of our own logic so it's not the "thinnest" wrapper.
We could of course test the wrapper (CollectBackgroundWorkManager) to give us more confidence. I'm comfortable with it being at the "edge" of our system enough that it doesn't need that but that's a pretty subjective statement. If you're feeling really uncomfortable with it I can have a stap at tests for the CollectBackgroundWorkManager. I'm not sure how feasible it would be for JobManager (although at worst we could wrap it in a veru light method proxy interface for tests) but WorkManager provides faking tools as far as I've seen.
replies.author: seadowg

replies.bodyText: Ok so let's merge it as is not to block other prs but if you have time you can add test if it's difficult please just let the QA team know about it so that they can verify this case manually one more time.
replies.author: grzesiek2010

replies.bodyText: Ok that sounds good. I'll have a look at that. Go ahead and merge when you're ready!
replies.author: seadowg

timeline.author: grzesiek2010
